channel.title: Discrete-modeling on The Vera-Licona Lab
channel.description: Recent content in Discrete-modeling on The Vera-Licona Lab

item.title: Cancer Reversion: Computational Systems Biology Approaches
item.description: Cancer reversion is the biological process by which tumorigenic cells lose their malignant phenotype. The objective of this project is to develop and apply novel computational systems biology tools to identify molecular drivers of cancer reversion, their mechanisms of action and their clinical application……

item.title: Development and Applicaton of Network Inference Methods
item.description: Much of our research work is related to the development and application of algorithms related to the different undertakings for the reverse-engineering of dynamical systems, with an emphasis on discrete dynamical systems. These undertakings include: (1) Data discretization, (2) Static Network and Dynamical Modelâ€™s Inference, (3) Validation and Benchmarking of Reverse-engineering Algorithms, (4) Model Analysis, Control and Simulation
